instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 20v 0.45A
threads.message: Another little water damage around <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>, board goes to dfu and if i revive, it gives error. stays 20v and 0.45a

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 20v 0.45A
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> i think it shows short because 10ohm to ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 20v 0.45A
threads.message:
At least the trace to <RESISTOR>R5630</RESISTOR> is also broken.
But the big problem is the SSD, which is probably damaged by overvoltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 20v 0.45A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 20v 0.45A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on 20v 0.45A
threads.message:
<CHIP>U9080</CHIP>, or mabe near filter caps, got burnt.
However, if you don't gte <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, will not help mchanging burnt component only.
Find the culprit, then rebuild the trace; maybe bad <RESISTOR>R5630</RESISTOR>.
